title: Feat: v2
body:
This pull request releases version 0.2.0 of the `crabgraph` crate, introducing major new cryptographic features, improved security, comprehensive standards compliance, and enhanced serialization support. The update also includes significant dependency updates, new APIs for streaming encryption and PKCS#8 key handling, and expanded test coverage. RSA support is now available behind a feature flag, but with documented security warnings. Several examples and documentation sections have been updated to reflect these changes.

**Major new features and APIs:**

* **Streaming AEAD Encryption:** Added high-performance streaming encryption/decryption for large files using `Aes256GcmStreamEncryptor`, `Aes256GcmStreamDecryptor`, `ChaCha20Poly1305StreamEncryptor`, and `ChaCha20Poly1305StreamDecryptor`, with nonce-reuse resistance and comprehensive tests.
* **Serde Serialization Support:** Added optional (feature-flagged) serialization/deserialization for ciphertexts, Ed25519 public keys, and signatures, with examples for JSON, TOML, and binary formats. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-06572a96a58dc510037d5efa622f9bec8519bc1beab13c9f251e97e657a9d4edR10-R93) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5R106-R176) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542R94-R101)
* **PKCS#8 Key Import/Export:** Implemented full PKCS#8 DER/PEM support for Ed25519 and X25519 private/public keys, including SPKI support and standards-compliant examples.
* **RSA Support (Opt-in):** Added RSA-OAEP encryption and RSA-PSS signatures (behind the `rsa-support` feature flag), with security warnings, benchmarks, test vectors, and usage examples. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-06572a96a58dc510037d5efa622f9bec8519bc1beab13c9f251e97e657a9d4edR10-R93) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L170-R258) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-db89136aba2a8e0b3889c747676c355e750967b7f3a1ca907f7ac642ec49788bR1-R5) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-db89136aba2a8e0b3889c747676c355e750967b7f3a1ca907f7ac642ec49788bR60-R104)

**Security and standards compliance:**

* **Constant-Time Operations Audit:** Integrated the `subtle` crate for constant-time comparisons, audited all MAC and AEAD operations, and added comprehensive documentation for constant-time usage.
* **Comprehensive RFC/NIST Test Vectors:** Added 13 new test cases covering 28 test vectors from 8 standards (NIST, RFC 7539, RFC 4634, RFC 4231, RFC 6070, RFC 5869, etc.).

**Dependency and documentation updates:**

* **Dependency Updates:** Upgraded 21 dependencies (RustCrypto, ed25519-dalek, x25519-dalek, zeroize, subtle, pkcs8, base64, proptest, etc.) to latest stable versions, ensuring compatibility and improved security.
* **Documentation and Examples:** Updated README, CHANGELOG, and TODOs to reflect new features, usage patterns, and security notes. Added new example code for streaming encryption and serialization. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-06572a96a58dc510037d5efa622f9bec8519bc1beab13c9f251e97e657a9d4edR10-R93) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L22-R28) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5R106-R176) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-5f9ffbfd10f7bc7a634b3f660c018a181a6d5b424376b22ea24a107ec097f042L8-R54) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-5f9ffbfd10f7bc7a634b3f660c018a181a6d5b424376b22ea24a107ec097f042L234-R251)

**Other improvements:**

* **Cargo.toml and Build:** Updated version to 0.2.0, excluded development files from published crate, and added new dev-dependencies and example targets. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L3-R3) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542R15-R81) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542R94-R101)
* **Benchmarks:** Added RSA benchmarks (behind feature flag) and improved usage of `black_box` for benchmarking. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-db89136aba2a8e0b3889c747676c355e750967b7f3a1ca907f7ac642ec49788bR1-R5) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-db89136aba2a8e0b3889c747676c355e750967b7f3a1ca907f7ac642ec49788bR60-R104) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-882df0fd96f39bc55af058f0d71d3eb9d3426eb60ccc7c166155a3fe803f6345L2-R3) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-9bac9611e8d7836617df1b405c42f42db381a511979be31f23e9e8db9929ddeeL5-R6)

These changes collectively deliver a significant upgrade to the crate’s cryptographic capabilities, security posture, and usability for a wide range of applications.
